fullText: This jukebox musical built around '80s rock anthems is a goofy, good-natured crowd-pleaser that knows exactly what it is and never pretends to be anything more.
dtliExcerpt: This jukebox musical built around '80s rock anthems is a goofy, good-natured crowd-pleaser that knows exactly what it is and never pretends to be anything more.
bwwExcerpt: Director Kristin Hanggi knows better than to loiter long between songs, and while it's overstretched for a show that waves its lack of substance like a banner, Rock of Ages keeps moving. Choreographer Kelly Devine gleefully apes the worst excesses of the era's pole-dancing, crotch-grinding, big-hair-tossing moves; costumer Gregory Gale re-creates the wardrobe crimes with flair; hair guru Tom Watson has worked overtime with the curling wand; and Jason Lyons' aggressive lighting cranks up the heat.
